title: Solar Orbiter ready for close encounter with Venus
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) is ready to guide the ESA/NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft through its closest encounter with Venus so far.

title: Cookies, Cream, and Crumbling Cores
summary: Perseverance’s drives over the last few weeks have doubled back several times. Why such an unconventional route? Team scientists have been delighted to find new kinds of rocks that could be the oldest ever found on Mars and are eager to collect samples. title: Live coverage: SpaceX Falcon 9 launch to feature first landing attempt in The Bahamas
summary: The Falcon 9 first stage booster, tail number B1080, will target a landing near Exuma, an island within The Bahamas. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 6 p.m. EST (2300 UTC).

title: SpaceX invited to provide input on FAA air traffic control modernization
summary:
Secretary of Transportation Sean Duffy says he has invited SpaceX to provide input on improving the FAA’s air traffic control system.
